entry.title: üîµ AI Won't Take Your Job. But Someone Using it Might
entry.content:
AI is reshaping careers across industries ‚Äî changing how work is organized, which skills matter most, and how teams deliver value. Roles are evolving, with some skills losing relevance and others becoming critical. For developers, this means more than just learning a new tool: it‚Äôs about rethinking how you solve problems, build solutions, and collaborate. This session explores the broad AI-driven trends affecting everyone, then zeroes in on what developers can do to adapt ‚Äî from integrating AI into your workflow to sharpening the skills that AI can‚Äôt replace."

Speaker:

  • Timo Elliott

Timo Elliott is a speaker, moderator, and interviewer, interested in real-world impacts of tech. He is a ‚Äúsliding sports‚Äù enthusiast, currently learning to wingfoil.

entry.title: Supplier Outgoing Payment Workflow process
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

I am working with SAP S/4HANA Private Cloud 2023, and we would like to understand how to properly set up the supplier outgoing payment workflow.

While exploring the Manage Automatic Payments app, I noticed that the process flow is quite lengthy (parameter generation, proposal editing, and payment submission). We created some simple workflow rules, and I have attached screenshots for reference.

However, in the authorizer‚Äôs decision-making screen, the user does not see the expected Release/Approve or Reject options.
Instead, the screen shows Open Task, under which only edit parameter actions are available (please see attached screenshot).

Could you please confirm if this is the standard behavior in S/4HANA Private Cloud for payment workflow?

If not, kindly guide me on the required configuration changes to enable the proper Release/Approve/Reject functionality.

Thank you in advance for your support.

Thanks & Regards,

silambarasan R

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud TM and WM Integration for Inboun...
entry.content:
Hello @ThomasSlack27 

While awaiting SAP‚Äôs note update, here are practical options currently used by customers in S/4HANA Public Cloud for inbound (PO) with TM/WM

Use ASR where available, TM -WM receiving

If your tenant releases and permits scope, Advanced Shipping & Receiving links TM freight orders to warehouse unloading and goods receipt (GR). Manage this process through Load or Unload Freight Orders and track progress in the ASR Cockpit. A key requirement is that the receiving point must be specified for the plant or storage location; without it, inbound processing in TM will be blocked.

Inbound focused on delivery without TM.

Several customers continue to handle transport planning outside S/4 HANA Public Cloud or manually and run inbound processes purely through Inbound Delivery and EWM.

  • Create an inbound delivery from the supplier ASN (EDI/Peppol/Ariba), then perform putaway in WM/EWM. This method serves as the simplest fallback when TM coupling isn‚Äôt required for receiving.

Synchronous Goods Receipt, no delivery, no TM

For chosen flows, post GR directly to the warehouse (scope 5HN). The system automatically creates and executes putaway tasks without requiring a delivery document, which is helpful when transport orchestration occurs outside S/4 HANA Public Cloud.

If your inbound is STO rather than a supplier PO

ASR for internal moves depends on the correct location and receiving point setup, enabling TM to plan accurately. If this applies to you, review the TM location determination guidance for STO enablement.

If you provide your release details, such as 2508, including whether it's inbound from a supplier PO or STO and the necessary transport modes, I can determine the best path (ASR, delivery-centric, or synchronous GR) along with the relevant apps and configuration touchpoints.

(GenAI assist content)The following official SAP Help Portal links and learning resources confirm the capabilities of inbound TM-WM integration in SAP S/4HANA Cloud via Advanced Shipping & Receiving (ASR).

Advanced Shipping & Receiving (ASR) Overview-SAP Learning. This document provides a high-level overview of ASR, the overarching process that manages the entire product flow, including inbound scenarios.

Inbound Freight Unit Building (FUB)-SAP Help. This section explains how freight units can be automatically generated for inbound procurement documents, serving as the initial step for TM-WM integration.

Fiori Apps for ASR:-SAP Help. This app library entry explains the Fiori applications used to perform the ASR process, such as Load or Unload Freight Orders, which are essential for managing inbound receiving in the warehouse.

Prerequisites to Start Using Order-Based Planning with Flexible Master Data-SAP Help: This documentation highlights essential prerequisites for ASR, stressing the importance of EWM-managed locations and accurate master data configuration to prevent common integration problems.

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: JSON not supported using the Datastore connection Web...
entry.content:
Hi @Kranthi_1987 ,

  1. Use SOAP UI to create a REST project and then export the REST project to a `wadl` file. 
  2. Make an API call to the endpoint and get the JSON response.
  3. Convert the JSON response to an XML response.
  4. Convert the XML response to an XSD
  5. Modify the `wadl` file and add the <grammars></grammars> section.
  6. Inside the <grammars></grammars> section insert the XSD in step 4.
  7. Make sure that the  request and response sections of the `wadl` are setup correctly.
  8. In SAP Data Services designer create a Web Service REST Datastore and the URL to the web service should be the path to the wadl file.
  9. Then import the REST functions and build your jobs.

References

Web Application Description Language

entry.title: Enhancing Unit Testing in SAP CAP Java Applications with GitHub Copilot
entry.content:
Introduction
Building upon SAP's guide to unit testing in CAP Java, this post explores how GitHub Copilot can streamline and accelerate the process of writing unit tests in SAP Cloud Application Programming (CAP) Java projects.

GitHub Copilot is an AI-powered coding assistant developed by GitHub and OpenAI. It helps developers by suggesting code snippets, functions, and even entire test cases in real time, based on the context of what you're writing. Integrated into popular code editors, it speeds up development and reduces repetitive tasks.

Where GitHub Copilot Helps
GitHub Copilot assists by:

  1. Autocompleting test scaLolds
  2. Suggesting assertion logic
  3. Handling repetitive boilerplate (e.g., mocks and setup)
  4. Speeding up TDD cycles (Red ‚Üí Green ‚Üí Refactor)

How GitHub Copilot Can Help in Writing TDD Test Cases

In the context of SAP CAP Java, GitHub Copilot streamlines the process of writing unit tests, allowing developers to focus on defining behaviour and business logic.
Below we will demonstrate the example using a test case from SAP's guide to unit testing in CAP Java. The test case is part of the method ‚ÄúvalidateBookAndDecreaseStock‚Äù , which was introduced and tested manually in this post.

Let‚Äôs now see how GitHub Copilot helps implement the same scenario using a TDD approach, covering prompts, completions, and code refinements.

Scenario: Book Does Not Exist - We want to write a test for the case where a book ID in an order does not exist in the database.

  1. Red ‚Äì Write the Failing Test First

    Prompt Example:

    "Write a JUnit 5 test for validateBookAndDecreaseStock(List<OrderItems>) when the book does not exist. Mock the persistence service to return empty result. Expect Service Exception with message ‚Äì Book does not exist"

    Copilot Suggestion:


    This gives us a strong starting point ‚Äî the structure, mocking, and assertions are generated instantly. We can now refine or expand it as needed.

  2.  Green ‚Äì Implement Minimal Code to Pass the Test

    Once the test is in place and failing, we write just enough application code to make it pass.
    How Copilot Helps:
    ‚Ä¢ Copilot can suggest the implementation stub or completion for the service method.
    ‚Ä¢ It recognizes context (e.g., entity names like Books, usage of persistence Service, and typical CAP patterns).

    Prompt Example:

    ‚ÄúImplement the validateBookAndDecreaseStock method so it throws a Service Exception when the book is not found.‚Äù


    Copilot Suggestion:


    While still minimal, this satisfies the failing test and progresses the TDD loop.

  3.  Refactor ‚Äì Clean and Improve Code

    Once the test passes, the code can be cleaned up. Copilot can assist by:
    1. Suggesting improved variable naming

    2. Identifying reusable logic (e.g., extracting methods)
    3. Completing more idiomatic Java or CAP Java constructs

    Prompt Example:

    "Refactor validateBookAndDecreaseStock to extract book lookup into a separate private method."

    Copilot Suggestion:


    GitHub Copilot provides several other ways to improve our development workflow. Below is a table showcasing additional use cases and how it can support us throughout the process:


    Way Copilot Helps

    Description

    Prompting

    Provides code suggestions based on the context of your work, helping you quickly generate code snippets and complete tasks.

    Auto-completion

    Suggests auto-completions for common code patterns like variable declarations, method signatures, or class instantiations, reducing the need to write repetitive code.

    Refactoring Suggestions

    Suggests improvements in code structure, like method extraction or renaming variables, for cleaner and more maintainable code.

    Context-Aware Suggestions

    Generates code that fits with the specific libraries or frameworks you're using, ensuring adherence to best practices.

    Error Handling Recommendations

    Helps identify and handle potential exceptions or edge cases by suggesting relevant error handling and assertions.

     

Conclusion

In conclusion, GitHub Copilot significantly enhances the unit testing process in SAP CAP Java applications by providing real-time code suggestions, automating repetitive tasks, and ensuring comprehensive test coverage. By streamlining the creation of test cases, mocking dependencies, and improving code structure, Copilot accelerates the TDD workflow, allowing developers to focus more on business logic and less on boilerplate code. Its ability to suggest improvements and handle edge cases ultimately leads to cleaner, more maintainable code and a more efficient development process.

Disclaimer

The views and opinions expressed in this blog post are those of the author and do not necessarily reflect the official policy or position of SAP or its affiliates. This content is provided for informational purposes only, based on the author's personal experience and understanding.

This blog references the use of GitHub Copilot, an AI-powered coding assistant. The suggestions generated by Copilot are not guaranteed to be accurate, complete, secure, or compliant with any specific coding standards or organizational policies. Developers are responsible for reviewing, validating, and testing all code before use in any production or sensitive environment.

SAP makes no representations or warranties, express or implied, regarding the suitability or accuracy of the information or tools mentioned herein.

entry.title: Shifting Table Data Based on Parameter Value
entry.content:
Hello team!
I have this table, and I want the data to shift forward based on the value I define in a parameter. For example, if I set the parameter to 2, all the data in the table should move forward by 2 months, and the first 2 months should be set to 0.
Is it possible to do this?

I tried using this code. It shifts the months according to the value I set in the parameter, but then it sets everything to 0:

 

DATA(
[d/Measures] = "Valor",
[d/Date] = NEXT(%PMR%, "MONTH")
) = RESULTLOOKUP(
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
)
 
DATA(
[d/Date] = PREVIOUS(%PMR%,"MONTH",[d/Date]),
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
) = 0

entry.title: Re: Filter for last event of any case with Signavio Proce...
entry.content:
Hi Sam,

thanks for reaching out!

One of my colleagues and I discussed the workaround you suggested. We figured it would require us to already build the full eventtable as a data view. In the eventtable data view we could add all the attributes we need like case_level_last_end_time. Then we can add the custom attributes to the objects and build the events again, such that the nested table can be built properly by Signavio. This seems pretty redudant and time consuming to us.

For single widgets within the dashboard, we were able to neatly create case_level_last_end_time with Signal subqueries. However this has to be done for every single Widget manually...

Something along the lines of:

SELECT
  case_id
  , event_name
  , end_time
FROM(
  SELECT 
    case_id
    , event_name
    , end_time
    , (SELECT LAST(end_time)) AS case_level_last_end_time
  FROM THIS_PROCESS
) AS sub
FILTER EVENTS WHERE end_time = case_level_last_end_time

The feature of calculated attributes seems to solve all of this hassle! We would be super interested in early access. I'll reach out privately.

Best,

Benedict

entry.title: Re: Shifting Table Data Based on Parameter Value
entry.content:
@Carvalho_A1 

Its deleting everything as you are asking it to do so. You are executing the below for all dates shifted 2 periods back.

DATA(
[d/Date] = PREVIOUS(%PMR%,"MONTH",[d/Date]),
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
) = 0
 
Better you delete shifting 2 periods forward from first month.
// First shift the values
DATA(
[d/Measures] = "Valor",
[d/Date] = NEXT(%PMR%, "MONTH")
) = RESULTLOOKUP(
[d/Measures] = "Valor"
)
//Now Delete, Assuming %PMR% is type Integer
IF MONTH([d/Date]) <=%PMR% THEN
DATA([d/Measures] = "Valor") = 0
ENDIF
Nikhil

entry.title: Re: Customer/Vendor Address Data Cleansing with SAP DQM (Data Quality Management)
entry.content:
Absolutely! Address data is one of those tricky little details that can silently derail a project if it‚Äôs inconsistent. When migrating to S/4HANA, even minor differences in spelling, formatting, or country codes can create headaches that slow everything down.

What‚Äôs fascinating is how addressing these inconsistencies highlights the real power of Data Quality Practices. By validating addresses against trusted reference sources and applying proper formatting rules, you‚Äôre not just ‚Äúfixing errors‚Äù, you‚Äôre creating a foundation where all other processes can run smoothly. It‚Äôs like cleaning up a messy workspace before starting an important task; everything flows better once the basics are solid.

It‚Äôs a great reminder that in data projects, the smallest things matter. Taking the time to get addresses right isn‚Äôt just a checkbox, it‚Äôs a step that makes the entire migration more predictable, accurate, and efficient. The little things really do make a big difference! This is exactly where PiLog‚Äôs Data Quality Management comes in, helping organizations systematically ensure that addresses and other critical master data are accurate, standardized, and ready for a smooth migration.

entry.title: Re: SuccessFactors Learning
entry.content:
Hi @Matthew_Knight 

Depending on what needs to be updated, the Import Data tool can be used. Please note that completion dates & times can't be changed massively (2449530).

Other than the above, there is no tool nor configuration that allows a mass update / deletion of Learning History records (2436676). But it can be done manually, one by one (2340618).

In case your team requires a mass update / deletion that can't be achieved by the standard tools and options available, then it's necessary to engage SAP Professional Services team (2149831) to check the possibility of having a script executed.

Best regards,

entry.title: Re: Evaluating SAP‚Äôs new MCP servers: UI5, CAP, and Fiori tools in practice
entry.content:
Hey Marian, Thanks for the great overview and feedback! Quick info regarding the errors you experienced with the UI5 MCP Server:

The server currently relies on the UI5 CDN for fetching some of the necessary resources for the API reference tool (we plan to move this to npm in the future). It seems like your first project is unfortunately using a rather outdated version of UI5. Version "1.108.1" is over one year old and therefore got removed from the CDN [1]. Upgrading to the latest "1.108.45" release in your ui5.yaml should resolve this. We will improve the error message there.

Regarding your Fiori elements app, I believe you found a bug affecting projects without any framework configuration in their ui5.yaml. We just released a fix for that [2]. You can try it using v0.1.1 of the package.

I hope this can help you to get things working! If not, and also for any other feedback, please let us know over at https://github.com/UI5/mcp-server/issues or reach out on the usual channels üòä

Thanks again!

[1] https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/removing-outdated-ui5-versions-from-ui5-cdn/bc-p/13954871
[2] https://github.com/UI5/mcp-server/pull/18

entry.title: Re: Asset APC value in AR02 report double
entry.content: The transaction for the Asset Balances report is AR01, not AR02. The Asset History Sheet is AR02.

entry.title: Exploring Salesforce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite
entry.content:
Overview - As part of my recent Migration project from MuleSoft to SAP, I was able to explore the salesforce adapter. Sharing across the adapter configuration - which can be helpful for other project's use cases. 

Pre-reading - 

Overview | Salesforce Adapter for SAP Integration Suite | SAP Business Accelerator Hub

sObject Types | Apex Developer Guide | Salesforce Developers

SOQL SELECT Syntax | SOQL and SOSL Reference | Salesforce Developers

Pre-requisites - 

  • OAuth Client Credentials are deployed in tenant 
  • Connectivity is working with salesforce 

Basic PoC Flow -

 

Please find configuration of the adapter for different CRUD operation :

Operation 1 : SOQL Execute query

Fetches the data based on the query passed, one can select the payload as xml or json based on the interface requirement.

Operation 2 : CREATE - Custom Salesforce Object is being used. 

Operation 3 : DELETE with External ID

 

Operation 4 : UPDATE - Custom Salesforce Object is being used. Upsert payload is set in content modifier in step ahead of SF adapter.

Operation 5 : UPSERT  with External ID - Custom Salesforce Object is being used. Upsert payload is being sent in the field External ID Value. External ID Name consists of the mandatory key. 

For custom object SD_Job_Activity__c as seen below Id is the key in the Salesforce

The upsert payload needs to be in single object format. Sample Reference upsert payload shared below -

   {

      "SD_DCFR_Sync_Action__c":"None",

      "SD_DCFR_Sync_Status__c":"Synced",

      "SD_DCFR_GUID__c":"2f13ffdc-4101-434b-b94d-300a7c70e4c5",

      "Id":"aEzDw00000006zSKAQ",

      "SD_DCFR_Sync_Message__c":"Activity created successfully in DCFR |  | Crew Details missing in the payload"

   }

Alternatively, One can use salesforce objects - composite - for multiple records update scenario.

entry.title: How to Integrate SAP Document AI with SAP Build Process Automation
entry.content:
Perfect üëç Here‚Äôs your full rephrased + enhanced message including the part about creating an Action for file upload. You can use this directly in your SAP Community or Blog:

I have created an instance of SAP Document AI and built a few custom schemas to read PDFs. Everything works fine when tested directly in Document AI.

Now, I want to integrate it with SAP Build Process Automation (BPA). For this, I have already created a destination.

My question:
üëâ How can I create an Action in BPA to upload a file to Document AI?

  • Do we need to use a Custom Script to achieve this, or is it recommended to only create Actions in BPA and then call them in a process?

If the recommended approach is to use an Action, can someone guide me on how to create an Action in BPA for file upload?

Specifically:

  • How should the input parameters (like PDF file and options JSON) be defined in the Action?

  • How do we configure the multipart/form-data request inside the Action?

  • Once created, can this Action be directly reused in different BPA processes for uploading files?

Would really appreciate your guidance. Thanks in advance!

For reference, below are the steps I followed in Postman which work successfully:

Step 1: Upload the PDF

Call the Upload API with multipart/form-data.

  • file ‚Üí PDF document

  • options ‚Üí JSON with schema details

Example:

{
  "schemaId": "69d84f47-b658-46fb-a330-d9aadd602112",
  "clientId": "default",
  "documentType": "invoice"
}

üëâ Response returns a Job ID.

Step 2: Check Job Status

Use the Get Job API with the Job ID.
Proceed when status = SUCCEEDED.

Step 3: Fetch Extracted Data

Call the Get Result API with the Job ID to get the extracted data in JSON format (header details, line items, etc.).

‚úÖ Now, I‚Äôm looking for help on how to configure this same upload flow as an Action in SAP BPA, so I can call it directly from an automation.

entry.title: Re: How to perform a reversal for a stored material in SA...
entry.content:
Hello @Alptekin26 

In Public Cloud WM, you can reverse GR only before the final putaway. After putaway is completed, reversal is not permitted by design. Use one of the supported paths below.

If put-away is not completed yet

App: Change Inbound Deliveries ‚Äì Deliveries ‚Üí Reverse Goods Receipt.

Reversal is prevented if: putaway is marked as Completed, there are open warehouse tasks, a quality decision has been made, or the stock content has changed, such as HU deletion or stock type modification. SAP Support Portal-SAP Help

If the putaway is completed, your case

Use Return to Supplier BMK: create return PO - pick - Post GI against the return delivery; or Post an Unplanned Goods Issue as a correction, ensuring serial numbers are provided
Attempting to reverse in Post Goods Movement (F1077) after EWM distribution will result in an error according to the standard. SAP Support Portal-3455535 - Goods Receipt Reversal process for Inbound Deliveries in SAP S/4HANA Cloud WM

Tip for resolving serial-number conflicts

First align ERP serial ownership (e.g., stock transfer from the old SLoc/warehouse to the correct one), then proceed with the chosen correction so ERP and WM stay consistent.

Best regards,
Chuma

SAP KBA 3578446 - Error reversing goods receipt (GR) after putaway via F1077/MIGO - standard process not permitted once distributed to EWM. SAP Support Portal-3578446 - Error in reversing Goods Receipt after putaway in EWM using App F1077 Post goods movement (MIGO) in SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

entry.title: Re: How to Integrate SAP Warehouse Management with Quality Management ‚Äì Full Process Flow
entry.content:
Absolutely! You‚Äôre spot on, integrating Warehouse Management (WM) with Quality Management (QM) is crucial for smooth operations. When materials arrive, it‚Äôs not just about storing them; ensuring they meet quality standards before release is essential to prevent issues downstream. This coordination keeps inventory reliable and supports accurate reporting, reducing the risk of defective products reaching customers.

What‚Äôs particularly interesting is how a structured approach to Data Quality Management ties into this. By maintaining clean and accurate master data for materials, batches, and inspection records, organizations can make the WM-QM process much more efficient. Accurate data ensures inspections are correctly triggered, results are properly recorded, and materials flow seamlessly from receipt to storage to release.

It‚Äôs a great example of how attention to detail in data can make a big operational difference. When master data is well-managed, teams can focus on actual quality checks and logistics rather than chasing errors or inconsistencies. That‚Äôs where PiLog‚Äôs Data Quality Management frameworks can help‚Äîby providing the tools and processes to keep material and inspection data reliable, making the entire warehouse and quality workflow smoother and more predictable.

entry.title: Re: Left Shift Approach: Strengthening Data Migration with Data Quality
entry.content:
Absolutely! You‚Äôve captured it perfectly, Data Quality really is the backbone of any data project, whether it‚Äôs a migration or an AI initiative. Starting Data Quality early, during the business readiness phase, makes a huge difference. It‚Äôs like laying a solid foundation before building a house - the stronger the base, the smoother the rest of the project flows.

What‚Äôs engaging here is how each phase, from Kick-Off to Governance - connects and builds on the previous one. Iterative cleansing, requirement gathering, and ongoing monitoring ensure that by the time data is loaded into the target system, it‚Äôs accurate, consistent, and ready to support business processes. When Data Quality is integrated thoughtfully with Data Migration planning, the benefits ripple through the entire project - reducing errors, minimizing rework, and making downstream processes much more predictable.

This is exactly where a structured approach like PiLog‚Äôs Data Quality Management can make a real difference. By providing frameworks, tools, and best practices to implement these phases effectively, it helps teams ensure data is trustworthy from day one. It‚Äôs not just about correcting errors - it‚Äôs about creating confidence in your data, which ultimately makes the whole migration journey smoother and more successful.

entry.title: Re: SAP MDG: How to restrict not req. document type in SAP MDG Change Request (Customer/Supplier) UI
entry.content:
Absolutely! You‚Äôve clearly identified the issue - seeing both standard and custom document types during Change Request creation can make the process confusing and error-prone.

A smart way to tackle this is by applying Master Data Governance principles. By defining clear rules about which document types should be visible for specific processes, like supplier change requests, you can keep selections clean and consistent. Using PiLog Master Data Governance, for example, helps enforce these rules systematically, ensuring only the relevant document types appear without needing repeated manual deletions.

The takeaway is that with a structured approach, the system behaves predictably, errors are minimized, and the workflow becomes much smoother. It‚Äôs a great example of how thoughtful governance can solve everyday SAP configuration challenges efficiently.

entry.title: Datasphere: Reading/Storing User Prompt Input
entry.content:
Hello,

I would like to store a user's prompt selections on an Analytic Model, in a table for later use. I tried doing that via a SQL View without success using both an 'insert' statement directly as well as wrapping the insert in an 'exec', but the system seems to treat them as read-only procedures and throws an error. I understand the security reasons behind that and it makes sense,. What I have noticed, however, is that upon refreshing a view with Input Parameters, the values that are entered at first, remain as default values for the reprompt. This leads me to think that these values are cached somewhere. Does anyone know if there is a system table that stores the current session cache or something like that where I can read the prompt selections from? Or is this entirely cached by the browser?

Regards,

Dimitar

entry.title: Re: AI-Assisted ERP: Transforming SAP BTP Integration with Faster, Smarter iFlow Development
entry.content: AI is really changing SAP ERP development by making complex integrations faster and cutting down manual work. Cerebro SASA is a great SAP-certified tool that creates iFlows, mappings, Groovy scripts, and OpenAPI specs from FDS, saving up to 50% of development time. It also makes migrating from MuleSoft to SAP BTP easier. Kudos to the team for building such a powerful solution! With AI handling repetitive tasks, developers can focus more on innovation and new ideas. Thanks for sharing this valuable post!

entry.title: Re: Table maintenance alternatives in S/4HANA on premise
entry.content:
Thanks a lot for your reply. I agree with you that the Business Configuration Maintenance Object is the better choice compared to Custom Business Objects.

You mentioned the drawback regarding customizing transport, but I tested it by following this tutorial (Step 8):
Create Business Configuration Maintenance Object 

When I created a Business Configuration Maintenance Object, it became available in the Fiori app Custom Business Configurations, and there was a button to add the data to a customizing transport. This means the transport challenge is solved.

After doing some testing, I also noticed a few other advantages of the Business Configuration Maintenance Object compared to Custom Business Objects:

  •  You can fully define your own structure, rather than being limited to predefined data elements.
  • Data can be updated and transported via the Fiori app Custom Business Configuration.
  • Once it is available in Custom Business Configuration, there is no need for a separate tile, since the data can be maintained directly in the app.
  • Possibility to create language dependent text table.
  • Custom Business Object are based on the older BOPF framework, whereas Business Configuration Maintenance Objects follow the more modern approach.

The Business Configuration Maintenance Object feels much more future technology, especially if you want CBC integration, transport capabilities, and multilingual support.

Regards Kirsti

entry.title: Re: UI5 Application works from BAS, but from HTML5 Repo,...
entry.content:
I'd recommend checking the metadata URL without the language parameter to see if you get different results. I had a custom application using the partner directory service in BTP and when the language parameter was included it would cause the call to fail or return partial results. I had to modify the xs-app.json file to redirect to the straight metadata URL by excluding the extraneous details.  See below for what I used (removed other routes for clarity)- 

{
  "welcomeFile": "/index.html",
  "authenticationMethod": "route",
  "routes": [
    {
      "source": "^/api/v1/(.*)metadata(.*)$",
      "target": "/api/v1/$metadata",
      "authenticationType": "xsuaa",
      "destination": "pdconfiguration",
      "csrfProtection": false
    }
  ]
}

 

Regards,

Ryan Crosby

entry.title: Re: SAP PUBLIC CLIOUD
entry.content:
Hello @SAP_TECH2020 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, item fields will not display simply because you have created a header field. You need to create and publish the field within the item business context and enable it for the target app UI.

Recommendation:-

Open Custom Fields and Logic (F1481)

Create the field under the item context: Business Context -Transportation Order: Items. Then, save and publish to complete the process.  SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Fields

In the same field, navigate to UIs and Reports and enable the field for the Transportation apps you use (for example, Manage Freight Orders. Save. SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Fields  

Go to the app, open a freight order, navigate to the Items area, and add the column via Table Settings or Adapt UI. Then refresh your browser session. SAP Help Portal-App Extensibility: Freight Order Management (Key User)

If there is still anything missing.

Confirm the app supports item-level extensibility. Check App Extensibility: Freight Order Management (Key User). If the item isn‚Äôt listed, the page will indicate which parts are extensible. SAP Help Portal

Make sure you didn‚Äôt create the field in Transportation Order: Header by mistake. The header and item are in different contexts.

Avoid SAP GUI/Web Dynpro enhancements you may come across online; these are only relevant to on-premises or private-cloud TM. In the Public Cloud, stick to using the Custom Fields and Logic app. SAP Help Portal-Creating Custom Fields

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Distribution of AVC-objects
entry.content: Hi @Chuma, I have one more question about this issue. I thought the migration cockpit was used for the initial creation of objects?! However, in the VC environment, product releases are to be carried out at regular intervals. This means that new characteristic values are added, the rules are expanded accordingly, etc. These new features are to be implemented and tested first in the development/test system (cloud). Once these changes have been tested and approved, they are to be transferred to the production system. Should/can this also be done with the Migration Cockpit? In other words, do you have to copy every source code of relationships individually into the staging tables for example and then migrate them? Thank you very much for your help. Best regards

entry.title: Re: SAP BO WEBI Certification (C_BOWI_41)
entry.content: Hi Ganesh, That‚Äôs great you‚Äôve scheduled the C_BOWI_4.1 exam üëè With one month to prepare, I‚Äôd suggest focusing on: Universe design concepts Web Intelligence report building Formulas, variables, and query filters Scheduling and publishing reports Since you‚Äôre already working with BO 4.1 client tools, you have a good foundation ‚Äî just polish the exam-focused areas. For practice, I‚Äôd recommend checking out Pass4Exams ‚Äî they have well-structured question sets and mock tests for BO certifications that can really help you identify the key topics and get comfortable with the exam style. Good luck with your preparation, you‚Äôve got this! üí™"

entry.title: You‚Äôve Built Mining Momentum ‚Äî Here‚Äôs How to Keep It Going
entry.content:
Process mining isn‚Äôt supposed to be a one-team project. Yet, that‚Äôs how it often starts: a single use case, a small team, a proof of concept. When it works, word spreads.

Suddenly, your dashboards are being forwarded around the company. Teams are asking for access. Leadership wants broader insights. Your work is getting recognized, and your licensed usage is hitting the ceiling.

If this sounds familiar, it‚Äôs because you‚Äôre doing it right.

 

When Process Mining Grows, Your Setup Needs to Grow with It

Reaching 100% usage in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence isn‚Äôt a sign of failure; it‚Äôs a milestone. It means you‚Äôve proven the value of your efforts, and now it‚Äôs time to scale.

Our new record-based entitlements allow you to break through the usage cap and expand your mining practice without commercial hurdles or technical slowdowns. You‚Äôll be able to:

  • add more records based on need, not procurement cycles
  • support more teams and functions without friction
  • build on what‚Äôs already working, without changing your setup

 

How to Know You‚Äôre Ready to Scale:

  • You‚Äôve already exceeded your licensed usage
  • You‚Äôre launching multiple mining initiatives across teams
  • You‚Äôre collecting more process data than you can currently analyze
  • Colleagues are asking for broader access to mining insights 

If any of these apply, you‚Äôre at the next stage of maturity, and it‚Äôs time to support that momentum with the right commercial foundation. 

 

Get the Guide: Process Mining Without Limits

We‚Äôve put together a short, practical guide to help you understand how record-based entitlements unlock more value from your current SAP Signavio Process Intelligence investment.

üëâDownload the white paper

 

Let‚Äôs Hear From You

How has your process mining journey evolved? What pushed your usage past the original limit?

Join the conversation in the SAP Signavio Community or share your story in the comments below. Your insights might help another team take the next step.

entry.title: Re: Best Practice: Prozessstruktur f√ºr Logistik (Leergut-...
entry.content:
Hi,

also wenn man √ºber Best-Practice und Standards im Business Process Management (BPM) spricht, dann sind die ersten Stichworte:

  • APQC Process Classification Framework (APQC PCF): Prozess-Struktur die von einer Non-Profit Organisation entwickelt und herausgegeben wird (Helping Organizations Work Smarter, Faster, and with Greater Confidence | APQC)
  • Business Process Modeling Notation 2.0 (BPMN 2.0): Internationaler Standard f√ºr die grafische Modellierung von Prozessen (Business Process Model and Notation ‚Äì Wikipedia)

Die grunds√§tzliche Vorgehensweise in unseren Kundenprojekten ist, mit dem APQC PCF erstmal √ºber die Prozess zu sprechen, die ein Unternehmen eigentlich ben√∂tigt. Die Struktur und Klassifizierung aus dem PCF kann man in der Regel mehr oder weniger direkt in die Ordnerstruktur in Signavio √ºbernehmen. Dann kann man in Signavio mit BPMN 2.0 als Basis seine Regeln f√ºr die grafische Modellierung festlegen und letztendlich ans modellieren der relevanten Prozesse gehen.

Hoffe das hilft! Melde dich gerne wenn du mehr wissen willst üôÇ

Gru√ü,

Benedict

entry.title: External Source Document JV are not having the option of reversal
entry.content:
Dear all,

We have implement custom HR payroll in our system. Posting are happening correctly but we don't have the option of Reverse the journal entry. While posting the HR- FI journal entries there is no source documents or any journal entry voucher for reference.

Is there a way to reverse the Journal entry type External Source Document?

Thanks


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: External Source Document JV are not having the option...
entry.content:
Dear All,

Journal entry type "1847 - External Source Document" can not be reversed or cancelled once they have been posted. This is due to Legal reasons (Audit), and there is no original document created in the system for these entries.

The only way to reverse these posting is to create a manual journal entry with the offsetting entries. 

This scenario is explained in the KBA 3626309- Reverse Journal Entry Type '00107 - General Ledger Posting External System' Without Reposting https://me.sap.com/notes/3626309

Thanks.

Regards,
Anderson
SAP Support

entry.title: Re: JSON not supported using the Datastore connection Web...
entry.content: @Kranthi_1987, It should work, that's why you need to create a WADL file that tells DS how to read the JSON Response. Get the JSON Response and convert it into an XML and then conver that CML into an XSD and this XSD is the one that will contain the structure of the JSON response in XML format and this is what DS will use.

entry.title: Re: Automate PFCG process
entry.content:
Using the MENU_ADD_SERVICE does what i need it to.  I added SE16 to the Role Menu as 'Authorization Default'.

I generate the profile using function module PRGN_AUTO_GENERATE_PROFILE_NEW , and I have to set the ORG_LEVEL_WITH_STAR flag to 'X' to avoid a popup box saying Org Levels are unassigned.  After generating the profile, a lot of unwanted authorizations get added to the Role Menu, which we want to change to 'Inactive'.  I do direct table updates to tables AGR_1250 and AGR_1251 to set the DELETED fields to 'X'.  I know this is not recommended, but I can't find a method/function module that does it.  After setting these fields, the profile looks as it should in PFCG. 

When the user logs on, and uses SE16, they should be able to open the Transaction, but not be able to view the contents any tables.  As it turns out, they now have full access to SE16, with all tables available to them. I tried to regenerate the Profile after the direct table updates to AGR_1250 and AGR_1251, but that results in the S_TBAU_DIS and S_TABU_NAM authorizations changed from 'Inactive' to 'Active'.

Does anyone have an ideas on how to accomplish this?

entry.title: Re: Payments without boundaries: Embark on the future of payments with SAP Digital Currency Hub
entry.content: Africa, South Asia, and South America are the 'true mainstream emerging markets.' Their development path is not to follow North America's DeFi, but to start with more practical applications like Supply Chain Fi and PayFi. This is because these regions often lack sufficient traditional financial services, and blockchain technology can be of great use in these areas. These markets have not yet been 'priced-in' , but they possess immense future potential.

entry.title: Re: Wrong Accounting Period in Depreciation Posting
entry.content:
Theoretically, you could rerun the depreciation posting cycle for periods prior to the last posted period (provided they are open).

  • Depreciation Posting Run 
  • 2870963 - Depreciation run executed for a future period in transaction AFAB 

To be on the safe side, try this first in a sandbox or quality environment, then analyze the generated accounting documents.

Then, to prevent the users from skipping the period, make a custom logic in the FI Validation or only open required periods.

entry.title: RDDIMPDP Job gets deleted every hour
entry.content:
Hello, 

we have the issue that the Job RDDIMPDP gets deleted on the system after about 1 hour. We have in the TP-Systemlog the following error: 

So we schedule again with RDDNEWPP the job which works fine for a time frame not longer than 1 hour and the transports get imported fine during that time frame.

When we check in transaction SM37 the Job exist and is running fine the longest time about 1 hour.

So we waited until the time when the job is not more displayed an checked the systemlog transaction SM21 and found the following error which occures every hour, we have the same error on another system in the same transportlandscape but there no deletion of the job RDDIMPDP is done:

We will try to create the user in client 066 and see if it will help. We have created already in client 000 the user SAP_SYSTEM but that was not fixing the issue the job RDDIMPDP gets still deleted. Do you have any ideas how it could happen the the job RDDIMPDP gets deleted at the moment we run every 1 hour the report SE38 RDDNEWPP again so that transporting is possible until the RDDIMDP jobs gets deleted again.  We are not sure if the SM21 log entry we fround is realy cousing the issue. Do you have any ideas what could be checked to find out why the Job RDDIMPDP gets deleted on the system?

 

Thanks and Best Regards,

Daniel

entry.title: Re: Not able to pick the quantity in the delivery
entry.content: Is your issue resolved? If not, can you share the images of Item categories using for Delivery and sales order? Also, please make sure that your system has no custom ABAP changes for picking.

entry.title: Medical device stock to clinic and traceability for patient billing
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

We have a requirement from our customer who are into medical device manufacturing. The product is shipped to various clinics and hospitals for handover to the patients who are prescribed by the doctor. After the use for prescribed time the device is returned to the company for download of patient data. The invoice is raised after the patient data is downloaded by the company and shared with the clinic, hospital, patient themselves for the services as per any contractual terms (services is the report which is based on data downloaded from the device).

The device is serialized and the same device is used multiple times for different patients after which it becomes non operational and is disposed in controlled environment. (Since the company is FDA regulated)

My question to experts is as follows if someone has come across a similar scenario on any other project.

1) What would be ideal sales process for the product being sent to the hospital or clinic? (Consignment process? - May be too cumbersome for multiple hospitals or clinics to manage in SAP)

2) Once the product is returned back to the company for patient data download what would be the right process to keep track of the device which needs to be then used for a different hospital or patient for reuse? Any suggestions?

3) How to link the billing of the services (report based on download of patient data) with the device and the patient since the device was shipped to hospital or clinic (not directly to patient).

Any suggestion or pointers to any SAP documentation would be appreciated and helpful to find a suitable solution for our customer.

Thanks,

Kartik Shah

entry.title: Why do many power users still prefer SAP GUI over Fiori in S/4HANA?
entry.content:
SAP learner here üëã

As I dig deeper into S/4HANA UX, I keep running into a pattern: even in organizations with a well-set-up Fiori Launchpad, a lot of experienced users still default to SAP GUI. I‚Äôm not trying to start a GUI vs. Fiori war‚Äîgenuinely curious about the practical reasons behind this and what has worked to shift habits

I am looking answers for the following topics: 

  • A concrete task where GUI wins (e.g., ‚ÄúDisplay/Change X,‚Äù ‚ÄúHigh-volume posting,‚Äù ‚ÄúMass edits‚Äù).

  • Why Fiori fell short (speed? feature gap? layout? navigation?)

  • Workarounds or fixes you‚Äôve tried

  • If you‚Äôve successfully moved teams to Fiori, what made the real difference? 

  • Which roles experience the biggest benefits with a switch from GUI to FIORI? Which Roles generally prefer to stay in GUI?

entry.title: Limited Change Project Services in SAP Sales Cloud V2
entry.content:
Dear Community,

Currently, we use the Change Project functionality to transport our configurations between test and production systems.

Unfortunately, we find the current range of transport options to be very unsatisfactory. For example, customer-specific opportunity document types and forecast categories are not transported.

Do you know if these services will be available in "Change Project" soon?

Thank you very much in advance,
Jendrik

entry.title: Re: From Requirement to Configuration: Your Guide to Time Valuation in SAP SuccessFactors Time Track
entry.content:
Hello TB!

I just wanted to say how much I appreciate your blog ‚Äî it's super detailed and provides a comprehensive overview of everything one should know about building time valuations in SF. I especially found your valuation diagram insightful; it's a brilliant way to document the logic in a clear and practical format. I really like the idea of using such diagram format to support both configuration and communication of how the system is configured for after the project.

Thanks again for sharing your expertise!
Stephanie

entry.title: Vendor Down-Payment with F110
entry.content:
Dear Sap-ers,

I have a request for a Customer of mine, to make a change in the Down-payment request payment - F110.

Currently SAP F110 makes a clearing of a DP request with Sp. G/L Indicator F and post on Vendor Account item with Sp. G/L Indicator A - as best Practice. The entry is posted with Document Type KZ (default figure in FBZP Customizing) - the setting is similar for normal Payments and Paid Downpayments to Vendors.

The clue is that the Customer uses SAP Analitic Cloud and due to data structure the Sp. G/L Indicator is not replicated for reporting  - and only Value to check different types of Transactions in AP for the SAC Report "Vendor Open Item" is the Document Type.

Do you know a way to make F110 clearing process to use a different Document Type for nomal items and different for Down-payments ??

I tried a Substitution - but it's not used during F110.

 

Any idea ??

 

Thanks in advance!!

entry.title: Re: Fiori Elements save button does not work
entry.content: That is the last resort

entry.title: Re: Medical device stock to clinic and traceability for p...
entry.content:
Hello,

I understand that you're placing the medical equipment in hospitals or clinic later this will be issued to patients for the treatment.

Are you charging the customer or clinics?

If you're charging the customer then is there a commission or any charges you pay clinics?

No, I don't charge the customer but charging the clinic on behalf of patient then, I recommend the below:

1. Create a equipment master and serial number, link it to your material master.

2. Sales order (assign the serial number) and process the delivery.

Note: I guess you will be delivering 100s of units to various clinics better option would be going for Consignment sales as this process allows to bring back to your plant.

I tried my best to understand your query and recommend the option I know üôÇ

Thanks
